infos.value: The older twin born to King Oelde and Queen Helena of Leonis. He dislikes war and believes in coexistence rather than power and conquest. After meeting Machérie, Princess of Hourne, he realizes that he needs to become stronger in order to protect those he loves.

The younger twin born to King Oelde and Queen Helena of Leonis. He has inherited his father's skill with a sword, and there are many who hope that he succeed the throne, rather than his brother. Because he was forbidden from going to battle, a confrontation with Oelde is becoming inevitable.

A valiant warrior and king of Leonis, who with Queen Helena has two twin sons, Mont and Sterne. His priority is the continuation of the royal bloodline, at times disregarding his affection towards his sons and making dispassionate decisions to protect at least one of them.

The king of Hourne, known for his patient, benevolent nature. Although he dislikes conflict, he decides to give his daughter Machérie away in an alliance with Fennes after Sadali, head of the church, warns him of the incoming invasion by the powerful country to the west, Rundall.

Commander of Hourne's first division, «Solidus». From a family of knights that has served Hourne for generations, he has become known as the strongest shield in Hourne as a result of enduring his father's strict training. He awaits the day he can fight against the country of Rundall and avenge his father's death.

A wandering monk taken in by Sadali. However, all that awaited her at the church was more and more rigorous training. Later, under secret orders from Sadali, she was sent to Hourne as a spy with the objective of causing a rebellion and annihilating the nation.

A machinist from a continent other than Ardra who specializes in constructing personalized weapons. She left her hometown to travel the world and polish her skills. Her credo is that there is a weapon for everyone.

A great mage that has donned many names. Although she appears young, rumors say she's hundreds of years old. She avoids getting involved in things which do not interest her, but it seems she has both saved children from drowning in rivers and intervened in the wars of large empires.

A white mage from a continent other than Ardra. She was born with a rare talent for magic, unmanageable by those around her. However, after being found by a certain traveling mage, her magic ability was able to blossom. While she's extremely gifted, she can also be a bit of an airhead.

The fortitudinous daughter of Robb, King of Hourne, who always follows things through to the end. She has confidence in her ability to read people. On the way to meet her in-laws-to-be, her carriage is attacked by an unidentified group of bandits, but this leads to her fateful encounter with Mont.

The queen of Leonis and mother of Mont and Sterne. She has full trust in King Oelde and is willing to give her own life for the sake of her country. It's not very well known that, before marrying into the royal family, she was actually a powerful black mage feared by enemy countries.

A knight who leads Leonis's second division, «Caelum», and is feared by the neighboring countries for her swordsmanship. She has a rough manner of speaking but a strong sense of justice and cannot abandon those in need. She takes good care of Mont because he resembles the brother she lost in battle.

A lancer from Leonis's second division, «Caelum», and Lilyth's right hand, whom Lilyth always turns to for advice in times of trouble. She is the greatest astrologer in the land and even joined Leonis's forces according to the guidance of the stars.

A swordsman invited to Leonis as a guest. Perhaps due to a sense of comfort, he joined «Fortem», the corps led by Sterne. Born and raised in the east, he is known for his valor and unique style of swordsmanship. He is Sterne's sword instructor.

A dragoon from Hourne's first division, «Solidus», who idolizes Engelbert's willingness to sacrifice himself in order to protect his allies. A rather hot-blooded man, his ancestor was one of few to be recognized by the dragon, but he makes sure not to let it go to his head.

A ruthless shinobi from Gouga working for Muraga who would kill his own family in a heartbeat for the right price. He sees the equally powerful shinobi village of Saiga as Gouga's enemy and lives for the purpose of exterminating the village in its entirety.

A hunter from Hourne's first division, «Solidus», who, desiring death by the hand of the strongest opponent, searches the battlefield for the one worthy enough to award him with his demise. His true identity is that of a spy sent by Sadali to prepare for the inevitable rebellion.

King of Wezette, who is also known as an archer of extraordinary skill. Ruthless and suspicious of others, he has little trust from his subjects, who have revolted numerous times in the past. He formed an alliance with Leonis only to have a buffer zone between Wezette and Hourne.

A cleric from Glaciela's personal brigade, «Spirare», who is Glaciela's half-sister from a different father. While still young, Glaciela places immense trust in Cadia for her lightning-quick thinking. She helped form «Spirare» in order to protect their family.

A monk from Wezette who lost both parents to war. She enlisted in the Wezette army to support her young brother but was at a loss at her inability to adapt to the strict rules. It was then that Glaciela, who cares for her like a sister, scouted her to join «Spirare».

A female mage who secretly facilitates the resistance group «Rubeus», who raid the homes of nobility to steal valuable items and earn money for the poor. Although King Khury hates the mere sight of her, she is on very good terms with his daughter Glaciela.

A woman created by Sadali who constantly follows him around like a shadow, acting as his personal guard. Even as Sadali falls deeper and deeper into the darkness, she continues to protect him, gently enveloping him in a soft light.

A knight from Hourne's first division, «Solidus», who possesses the name "First Sword" from his knack for rushing into the harshest of battles unafraid. Three days before the wedding ceremony with his beloved Naiah, he is ordered to escort Machérie to Fennes to be wed.

A young girl who appeared from within a crystal with no memories of her past, save her own name. Though she displays the innocence and curiosity of a child, her prowess with white magic and archery suggests there is more to her than she herself yet understands.

A knight from Leonis's second division, «Caelum», who is normally a laid-back gourmand. However, when his companions are in danger, he transforms completely into a valiant warrior. Mont's childhood friend, Mont asked him to join during the establishment of «Caelum».

A spellblade who, despite having no battle experience, managed to join Leonis's first division, «Fortem», after her bright and enthusiastic nature caught Sterne's eye. She is very proud of the name given to her by her mother and becomes upset when mistakenly referred to by a different name.

A dragoon belonging to Leonis who was originally enlisted in the army of her homeland, Rundall. The army led by Jayden was so powerful that battles got boring, and after wandering for some time, she joined Leonis. She believes that battling for one's life is more fun when on the weaker side.

An optimistic green mage from Leonis's first division, «Fortem», who can laugh off any kind of danger and doesn't hesitate to sacrifice himself for the sake of his allies. He has feelings for Ramada but agonizes over her enlistment in «Caelum», which prevents them from having any kind of interaction.

A white mage belonging to Hourne. She is in love with Schuzelt, whom she met by chance twelve years ago. She originally preferred to stay indoors and read but resolved herself to white magic in order to be of use to Schuzelt, to whom she is currently engaged.

A lancer who leads Wezette's first division, «Equito». Due to cold treatment from Khury, he has lost all love for his country, but he continues to follow the king's orders because he doesn't want to abandon his beloved subordinates.

A hunter from Wezette's first division, «Equito». Having lost his entire family in the fires of war, he was scouted by Serjes to join «Equito». His allies have faith in his superior ability with a bow, which is difficult to imagine from his youthful appearance.

A black mage from Wezette's first division, «Equito». He was forced into the army due to conscription, but because he hates the sight of blood, he chose to become a mage rather than a warrior. Although not a path he originally planned to take, his studious nature has led him to be a central figure in «Equito».

Head of Wezette's underground resistance group «Rubeus», who risk their lives to help the poor through acts such as stealing from nobility. Although King Khury is quite hostile towards him, he is on friendly terms with Serjes, leader of the first division, «Equito».

A woman created by Sadali who constantly follows him around like a shadow, acting as his personal guard. She is believed to have been based on the one woman Sadali ever loved. It seems that she feels no emotion, not even pain...

A time mage from the northern kingdom of Ovis. Half a year ago, the country was drawn into battle with Rundall despite no declaration of war and fell into ruin as a result. In order to save her country, she left on a journey to seek reinforcements from Hourne, but she knows deep in her heart that it may already be too late.

An archer from Leonis's second division, «Caelum», who surprised those around her at a young age when she hit bull's-eyes with arrows she fired while messing around. She joined «Caelum» after Lilyth told her she could become a world-class archer with the experience she'd gain in the army.

A black mage from the northern kingdom of Ovis. He formed a second platoon after losing contact with Phoebe, who, hoping to protect their homeland from Rundall, left to seek reinforcements from Hourne. He made his way east with Princess Lucielle, but an assassin from Rundall is also heading in that direction...

A thief of Saiga. Originally from a town destroyed by monsters, she is thankful to the chief of Saiga for taking her and her mother in when they had nowhere else to go. However, being unaccustomed to simple village life, she dreams of being appointed to a rich noble.

A warrior affiliated with Gouga. He loves nothing more than slaughter and has found a kindred spirit in Rairyuu, who introduced him to the shinobi village. He is said to be immortal as he is not killed as easily as most men.

A being surrounded in mystery whose wings of steel are said to transcend not only space, but time as well. He entrusts Leonis with the role of the "Guardian" and is trying to instigate the kings of each country to prepare for the impending "Time of Judgment."

Her penchant for pragmatism is matched only by her thirst for knowledge. Though she is renowned for her consummate mastery of white magic, she now turns to the dark arts that she might better contend with the challenges that lie ahead.

Thancred is an Archon in the Scions of the Seventh Dawn who specializes in survival and subterfuge. Espionage missions have taken him deep within Garlean territory, where he acquired the techniques of the gunbreaker─skills he will be forced to perfect if he means to protect those he holds dear.

One of the "People of the Forest" who inhabit the vast woodlands. After using her gun prowess to help the Hourne army fend off a surprise monster attack, she was scouted by Robb and left the forest to join «Solidus». She has a crush on the commander of «Solidus», Engelbert.

A shinobi from Saiga who was sold into the service of Hourne. She boasts undying loyalty to Robb and Machérie, who treat her like family. In particular, she and Machérie have been together since they were young, and she has always protected the princess like a bodyguard.

A red-headed warrior who continues to search for a man stronger than her. Many men have fallen for her beautiful looks, but she has yet to meet someone who can defeat her in battle. On her journey, she happened to become acquainted with Etre.

Out of her love for Prince Sterne of Leonis, she rejected the marriage arranged by her parents and left her village home behind. During the enlistment test for «Fortem», the division led by Sterne, she headed towards a skeletons' den; but, having no sense of direction, she got hopelessly lost in the caverns.

She left her home in hopes of joining «Fortem» after falling in love at first sight with Prince Sterne of Leonis. Originally from a poor village with an insufficient supply of weaponry, she chose to become a monk and fight with her own body, awakening her full potential through her own special method of training.

The third son of the renowned military family of House Beoulve. He appears in the legend of the Zodiac Stones, a story passed down in the otherworld of Ivalice. After much training, he achieved knighthood at the Royal Military Akademy. However, being born of a different mother than his older brothers—who already serve in prominent posts in the Order—he still feels somewhat inferior in their presence.

A mercenary serving the Order of the Northern Sky. He appears in the legend of the Zodiac Stones, a story passed down in the otherworld of Ivalice. His past is muddled. Though he achieved fame during the Fifty Years' War as a divisional officer of the Order of the Eastern Sky, the vile acts he committed in the name of claiming victory served as grounds for his expulsion after the war ended.

A knight with a fearful reputation among his enemies for being the undefeated general of the Fifty Years' War. He appears in the legend of the Zodiac Stones, a story passed down in the otherworld of Ivalice. He fights for the good of the people—never for the sake of seizing power—and has remained staunchly opposed to the War of the Lions and the political events that instigated it.

A woman created by Sadali who constantly follows him around like a shadow, acting as his personal guard. Her blood-red lips speak no words but are said to form into a half-smile after she slaughters someone who has wronged her master.

A shinobi girl who serves Leonis. Originally from Saiga, she was sold into the kingdom's service at a young age but was moved by the warmth of Lilyth and the others, swearing to serve Leonis for life. She is especially thankful to Mont, for whom she is starting to develop feelings of more than just gratitude.

A red mage from the east studying under Seymore. Though her original goal was to become a samurai, she frustratingly lacked the qualities necessary to become one. Impressed by Glaciela's stance on the importance of family, she fights with «Spirare» against King Khury.

A fiendish mercenary traveling the land. He works for Sadali only because he is sure Sadali will come into power, and he plots to use Muraga for his own benefit. After taking over Rundall, a powerful nation to the west, he plans on eliminating Muraga and taking Fennes's throne himself.

A dual gunner who leads Rundall's Third Division, «Calorum». She is usually calm and collected, but once angered, she fires her guns indiscriminately, making her feared by both friend and foe alike. She fiercely admires King Jayden and dreams of moving up to «Vanum».

A young red mage who leads Hourne's Second Division, «Nitor». While nothing usually fazes the calm-headed Adelard, his one weakness is his younger sister, Salire, whom he values more than anything. Recently, he regrets perhaps having spoiled her, but it's too late at this point.

A dragoon traveling the land who doesn't like spending money on things other than her own appearance. She answered King Khury's invitation to return to her homeland of Wezette, and he in turn promised she'd become queen should she lead Wezette to victory.

A black mage from Hourne's Second Division, «Nitor», and Adelard's younger sister, who speaks to even King Robb in an overly vulgar manner. She loves her brother dearly and thinks of anyone who tries to get close to him as an enemy, even becoming a black mage so as to protect him.

A knight of the Kingdom of Grandshelt. A precocious pilot who was entrusted with command of an airship at the tender age of eighteen, he maintains a carefree—some might say lackadaisical—demeanor. He has the unwavering trust of both the king and the populace, in large part due to his father's reputation as a stalwart knight of the kingdom.

A spellblade from a continent other than Ardra who is traveling in search of equipment suitable for her abilities, all the while hiding her elven heritage. After coming to know no greater joy than that of crossing blades with an opponent, she now hopes to challenge warriors all over the world.

An assassin from Fennes who was kidnapped from her village by Muraga to be trained in the art of assassination from a young age. Sadali schemed to send her to Hourne under the guise of Muraga's daughter with the goal of assassinating the prince of Hourne, Dario.

The prince of Hourne and Machérie's older brother. Although blessed as a natural spellblade, he hates fighting even more than his father does and has no desire to succeed the throne. Before Machérie is sent off to be wed, Dario accepts the king of Fennes's daughter, Vinera, as his princess.

A knight trained at the Serpent's Den, a shinobi training facility of Fennes. He was sent to Hourne as an escort to Vinera, who was wed to Prince Dario in order to assassinate him. At first, he hated Dario because of his feelings for Vinera, but...

A great hero sung of in tales from a distant world. The four Warriors of Light, with no memories to speak of, each bore a crystal that had lost its light. They realized that the crystals they held were inextricably linked to sustaining their world and set off on a journey to instill them with light anew.

Oldoa's right hand. She is originally from a frigid village near the border of Fennes and Wezette. Despite her wishes, she was made to serve in the war because of her unparalleled skills. Her only hope in life is her little brother, who was also taken prisoner, though she does not know if he is still alive.

A samurai from the east whom King Khury invited to Wezette due to his remarkable swordsmanship. However, after learning of the suffering caused by the king's tyranny, he began taking action with Glaciela's group. He is known for his love of alcohol.

A swordswoman that is distantly related to King Muraga of Fennes and the sole strategist of the Fennes army. Due to her deep adoration of Muraga, she naturally has negative feelings for Sadali as he treats Muraga like a subordinate.

A swordsman who roamed the land on her own after losing her parents and younger brother. She ventured to the far east for a certain purpose and told Owe and Seymore that she wished to become a samurai of the east, but what is her true aim...?

A knight of the royal guard belonging to the Atkascha royal family and Princess Ovelia's personal bodyguard. She appears in the legend of the Zodiac Stones, a story passed down in the otherworld of Ivalice. She is known for her nobility of spirit, tremendous loyalty, and strong sense of justice. As such, she can't help but pity Ovelia, who continues to be tossed about by the chaos of the world.

The son of a farmer in service to the noble House Beoulve. He appears in the legend of the Zodiac Stones, a story passed down in the otherworld of Ivalice. Ramza's father, Barbaneth, took him in after the death of his parents. It was thanks to this act of kindness that he was able to attend the Akademy—an institution usually only available to young nobles.

A young man employed in the mines of the Clockwork City of Goug with a knack for wielding mechanical pistols. He appears in the legend of the Zodiac Stones, a story passed down in the otherworld of Ivalice. After unearthing one such stone in the mines, he finds himself relentlessly pursued by the notorious Baert Trading Company and is eventually rescued by Ramza.

An arithmetician of Leonis, she dreamed of following in her late mother’s footsteps and becoming a tactician. However, Queen Helena worried for her safety and appointed her manager of Leonis’ finances instead. She believes that mathematics can change the course of battle.

Sterne, clad in the golden armor bestowed by founder of the Church of the Crystal, Sadali. Containing a hidden power, this sinister armor amplifies Sterne's hatred for his father, Oelde. When enraged, it becomes almost impossible for him to distinguish friend from foe.

A knight of the Kingdom of Grandshelt, he shares command of an airship with his childhood friend Rain. His skills are on par with Rain's, and his no-nonsense attitude has earned him the trust of his superiors and subordinates alike. However, he has a tendency to be dragged along by Rain against his own better judgment.

Daughter of Khury, King of Wezette. Her mother was not the queen but a maid, and many attempts have been made on her life by those aspiring to succeed the throne. She despises King Khury and is secretly assembling her own brigade in order to start a revolution.

The new chieftainess of Gouga. She was appointed by the previous chieftain out of concern for the future of the village following its descent into a self-serving band of murderers. In a twist of fate, she fell in love with the new leader of Saiga and has come to believe that the two villages should unite.

Only tricks and no treats if you can't say my name right! Hey, what are you laughing at? I'm serious! "What happens if you can't say my name right?" Why don't you try it and see? I get a feeling you'll regret it, though!

So this is the venue for the Halloween party, huh? Oh, would you just look at how many attendees there are. Well then, how about I give them a little surprise? No worries. No, I won't be going easy on anyone. I'll give them a taste of true fear.

The eldest child of the Groms family and a dashingly handsome rune knight. He refers to all women as princesses and cherishes his time with them more than anything—which led him to skip out on training more than a few times. As a result, he was disowned by his father and master and subsequently set out on a journey with his younger brother, Tyytas, and little sister, Chel.

The young new leader of Saiga. Though there have been hostile relations with Gouga, the other shinobi village, he is working towards uniting the two into a unified country. As his lover is the new chieftainess of Gouga, Loreila, he thought that the villages were soon to be united. However...

A female spellblade from Gouga. Though she was aiming to become the next chief, the title was taken from her by Loreila, causing her to harbor a murderous grudge. By having one of her subordinates observe Loreila, she has come to know about her repeated rendezvous with the chief of Saiga.

Whew, it's hot out! This calls for... Ta-dah! Take a look at this giant watermelon! And it's nice and chilled, too. Hey, what are you doing? Come on! Hurry! We can each have half—it'll be our little secret, okay?

The youngest child of the Groms family and a green mage. After their father and master disowned her older brother Howlet, she decided to accompany him on his journeys. She hates difficult things and is always smiling. Currently, she simply cannot help how much fun she's having visiting various countries with her beloved older brother.

A knight from a distant world with two moons. Once a dark knight who served as captain of an airship fleet of the Kingdom of Baron known as the Red Wings, he turned his back on his king after witnessing his cruel actions. In his journey to protect the Crystals, he decided to overcome his doubts and was reborn as a sacred paladin.

A woman from a distant world with two moons. A white mage of the Kingdom of Baron who excels at using bows as well, she is also known as the most beautiful woman in the kingdom. While she harbors deep feelings for her childhood friend Cecil, she has yet to notice the affections of Kain, whom she was raised alongside.

A dragoon of a distant world with two moons. He is the commander of the dragoons of the Kingdom of Baron in addition to being the close friend and rival of Cecil. While he is dignified and compassionate, he is poor at revealing his own feelings. He hides his love for his childhood friend, Rosa, at all costs.

Oops...you saw me. Is it bad if a shinobi can't swim? I nearly drowned when I was little, so I never liked the water. Uh...you are wondering why I am practicing? There's no way I could tell you I'm only doing this because there's someone I might want to go swimming with this summer...

I can see my breath as if it is freezing in the air. It is rather cold...but it is still a nice night. Thanks to this weather, I can see the stars so clearly. What are they singing of, you ask? It is undeniable, of course, that they bless us... Oh, but that is a secret.

Hmph... Why must I impart happiness unto others? ...Huh? Are you saying that you shall help me? So you are free this festive evening as well. I suppose I should say this before I forget, but...happy holidays.

A dual gunner who hates being tied down. Beyond simply loving freedom, she also travels from country to country. She came to Wezette not because she trusts Viktora, but because she has a hunch that something interesting may happen if they're together.

A paladin and the second son of the Groms family. Worried for his older brother, Howlet, whom their father and master disowned, he decided to accompany him on his journeys. While he is verbally strict on his older brother, their bond is strong, especially regarding their younger sister, Chel—both would come to her aid no matter the cost.

A swordsman from a continent other than Ardra. Seeking strength, he mastered the dark blade only to be met with contempt from his fellow knights. His wounded heart was swallowed by darkness, his comrades slain by his own hands. Remorseful over his actions, he eventually took his own life.

An archer affiliated with Gouga. Though she was originally a member of the wandering V Clan, they were annihilated by a surprise attack from Rundall's army. Since then, she lives as a person of Gouga after being taken in by the village, honing her archery while she awaits her chance to take revenge on the king of Rundall, Jayden.

A black mage affiliated with Saiga. She is unable to turn away from someone in need. She has therefore been hired by Ovis to fight the power to the west, Rundall, despite knowing that they have no chance of winning. She cherishes Kitone and Shadowlynx as though they were her sisters.

A mage encountered in Mysidia. Sakura's childlike appearance hides the fact that she is well over seven hundred years old. Her age shows in her dignified manner of speaking, and she has earned the respect of all the mages in the nation for her incredible magical prowess. Curiously, her true identity remains a mystery to those around her.

A young lancer born and raised in Saiga. Despite being afraid of conflict, she is capable of fighting bravely in the name of her village. She thinks of Kitone and Shadowlynx as older sisters and aspires to use the spear techniques her father taught her to protect people and instill them with happiness.

The commander of Rundall's second division, «Crucium». His demeanor suggests him to be a stubborn man who solves all problems with his fists, but that is simply because it is the easiest way to keep his troops in line. Aware of the threat guns will pose, he now deliberates how to best put these modern weapons to use.

A time mage belonging to Rundall's second division «Crucium». Previously a member of the first division «Sonitus», she was hand-picked by Rhaldor to serve as the deputy commander of «Crucium» at the time of its establishment. Convinced that the world was entering the age of the gun, she made the decision to bring Creysse into her division.

She writes his name on the frosted window with her fingertip and wipes it away moments later, too embarrassed to leave it on display. How many times has she done this? Will he be delighted by the ensemble she secretly made for this day? Her heart gripped half by anticipation and half by unease, the night grows late ever so slowly.

Oh, a present for me? You certainly have a lot of free time. Actually...I was just thinking about how much I wanted to see you. What's the matter? Come closer, you must be freezing. I'll warm you up, not to worry. See?

A gunner belonging to Rundall’s second division «Crucium». She joined the ranks of the renowned and unrivaled melee combat division out of her admiration for Lu’Cia, who already had a place in «Crucium». Firm in her belief that guns will change the state of battle in times to come, she continues to stand upon the battlefield.

A descendant of the oppressed people of Yezagh. Bought by Fennes, he was forced into slave work in their mines. His sister Velne is more important to him than anything in this world. A chance encounter with Galzahk leads to their escape, but their freedom is bittersweet...

A swordswoman of Leonis. However, she is not a member of any unit. Though she is blessed with her skills with a sword, she's known to fall asleep anywhere at any time. Because of this drawback, neither Mont nor Sterne have requested her enlistment. She has burning feelings of rivalry toward Lilyth.

A young man who appears in the tales of another world, where its people are trapped in a spiral of death. After being swept away from his home of Zanarkand and subsequently landing in the world of Spira, Tidus washes ashore at Besaid Island. There he meets a newly anointed young summoner named Yuna and joins her on a journey to defeat the eternal fiend Sin.

A young summoner who appears in the tales of another world, where its people are trapped in a spiral of death. Inspired by her father, she also chose to become a summoner and do battle with Sin. Before setting out on her pilgrimage to the ruins of Zanarkand, she has a fateful encounter with Tidus, the son of her father's friend, Jecht.

A swordsman who appears in the tales of another world, where its people are trapped in a spiral of death. He is a legendary guardian who once journeyed with High Summoner Braska. When the giant fiend, Sin, appears in the sleepless city of Zanarkand, it tasks him with guiding Tidus to Spira.

A unit of the YoRHa soldiers, a group from a faraway world made up of androids. This all-purpose combat model is capable of short-range sword attacks and is also equipped with a "pod" sub system which allows for long-ranged attacks. Her official designation is YoRHa No. 2 Type B.

A unit of the YoRHa soldiers, a group from a faraway world made up of androids. Though capable of close-range combat, he was especially designed as a research unit and is adept at gaining information via hacking. His official designation is YoRHa No. 9 Type S.

A young man who succeeded the throne of Leonis after his father, King Oelde, was defeated in battle against Sterne. He now takes haven in Hourne Castle after the emergence of the Crystal left his home blanketed in miasma, though he vows to one day return to the place of his birth.

A member of Queen Helena Leonis's elite guard, «Lumen». She has known Ildyra since they were children and possesses a mind of equally sharp clarity. Despising warfare from the bottom of her heart, she thought of what she can do to bring peace to her world and enlisted in «Lumen» in order to put her beliefs into practice.

A member of Queen Helena Leonis's elite guard, «Lumen». Through an unexpected twist of fate, she succeeded in passing the entry tests for «Lumen», which are said to be of the highest difficulty. She has promised herself that someday she will attain the same kind of elegance as Ildyra and find herself a handsome boyfriend.

The queen of Leonis. With «Fortem» at her side, she faces Dorando and Gargas in battle and is thought to have lost her life there. Taking advantage of this, she returns to the persona of the Black-Robed Witch she was once feared as before her marriage to Oelde. She now takes her fight to the shadows with the aid of Rafale and Eliza.

You said you like sweet things, right? Uh... D-don't get the wrong idea. These are just leftovers from the ones I made for my brother. So, how do they taste? Hehe, maybe I'll make more next year. Oh...forget what I just said.

A dragoon hailing from Heindler. Despite taking part in Rundall's assault on Ovis castle, he leaves the front line to pursue Deah, who was heading for Hourne to gather reinforcements. A womanizer through and through, he became a dragoon because he thought that would best ensure his popularity with the ladies.

Ah, so we meet again. Death and screams are as pervasive as ever in this land of Ardra, but no need to worry. It's for times like this that I, messenger of the gods, am here. Now, close your eyes. I'll have you shipped off to heaven before you even have time to feel pain.

The older sister of Ramada, a lancer in the service of Leonis. She is capable of reading the stars more accurately than her sister, but to achieve this she has discarded a number of emotions, "joy" being among them. She is driven only by her desire to exact revenge upon Rundall for wiping out her people.

A man born and raised in a small frontier village. He is a warm-hearted soul who has no taste for conflict. However, upon learning that the army of Rundall plans to use his homeland to establish a frontline base for an invasion into Hourne, he forms the Resistance and steels his resolve to fight as its leader.

The king of Fennes, the country of savages that controls the frontier lands. He believes Leonis's ancient relic is the reason that Fennes can't defeat Leonis despite its overwhelming military strength. He follows Sadali, head of the church, with plans to steal the artifact and use it to destroy Hourne.

A knight from a continent other than Ardra who is on active duty and a peer of Rain and Lasswell. Charlotte's stern and austere personality causes her to butt heads with the easygoing Rain, leaving Lasswell to bear the brunt of her complaints about his friend—quite often, it would seem.

An apprentice of the swordsmith Harvas. He was taken in by Harvas soon after his birth, and ever since then he has been training under the master swordmaker. Thinking that succeeding the Harvas name is the only path to marrying Lemuré, whom he was raised alongside like a sibling, he has poured himself into his training.

Immerse myself in the ocean in order to get through this hot summer weather? I see, it is indeed a reasonable proposition. However, why must I wear such scant scraps of cloth. Hm...so this is also standard summer procedure? I see... No matter. Let's go with that.

The problem with the ocean is that falling asleep in it means drowning, so I can't say I'm fond of it. And there is this sunlight... In any case, I much prefer lounging around my room napping. So why have I come to the beach, you ask? Hmph. I just thought we should make some memories together. I hope you appreciate this.

The sole daughter of the swordsmith Harvas. Out of respect for her father, she has dutifully served him, sacrificing all personal desires along the way. However, as he nears death, her heart wavers after learning of the ruthless method he intends to use to determine his successor from among his two apprentices, Zachar and Velric.

Dorando's younger brother, a fiendish mercenary who travels the land doing anything for status and fortune. He believes that foul play is an act of honor, but surprisingly, he pays proper respect to the truly courageous, whether they be friend or foe.

A young man at the center of a struggle to save his planet in a distant world. Cloud is a former member of SOLDIER, an elite group within Shinra's private army. After a request from his childhood friend Tifa, he joins the anti-Shinra organization Avalanche in their mission to destroy one of Shinra's mako reactors.

A young woman from a distant world who is embroiled in a struggle to save the planet. She is a member of the anti-Shinra organization Avalanche while also managing the bar Seventh Heaven in the Sector 7 undercity. At a time when her support for the operation to bomb a mako reactor is wavering, she is reunited with her childhood friend Cloud.

A young woman from a distant world who is embroiled in a struggle to save the planet. Contrary to her sweet appearance, she is plucky with a strong will due to her upbringing in the undercity. She met Cloud while selling flowers in Sector 8, and the two were later reunited at the church in Sector 5 where she asked him to be her bodyguard.

A man with a gun for a right arm who is embroiled in a struggle to save the planet. As leader of the anti-Shinra organization Avalanche based in the Sector 7 undercity, he forges ahead by taking radical measures to see things done. Extremely hot-headed, he is unable to focus on anything else once he gets fired up, yet his power to lead his companions is undeniable.

A legendary member of SOLDIER known as a hero who appears in tales of the distant mako-fueled city of Midgar. During the last war, he garnered many achievements while wielding Masamune, a katana with an incredibly long blade. Shinra released a formal statement noting that Sephiroth lost his life in the line of duty some five years past.

A self-styled materia hunter appearing in the tales of the mako-fueled metropolis Midgar on a distant world. A ninja of the Wutai, she can sling her oversized shuriken like it's second nature. Her impatient personality and tendency to look before leaping earns her no small amount of chiding from her partner Sonon.

Thank you for finding me amongst the nearly limitless choices before you. To be honest, I was worried that no one would. Yet you did, so I will do all that I can to live up to your expectations. May you continue to watch over me in times to come.

With her trusty dual pistols, renowned archeologist and adventurer Lara Croft travels the world and explores ancient ruins. Entrusted with the protection of dangerous secrets, Lara confronts evil forces in the deepest, darkest tombs…usually with a clever quip and a smile on her face!

One of the main characters of the graphic novel Fundamental Forces, popular in a world beyond Ardra. She has vowed to show no mercy to those who selfishly make others suffer, and keeps fighting against the wicked with help from her "partner" fastened to her left arm.

A descendant of the persecuted people of Yezagh and sister to Garvall. The two were enslaved by Fennes and forced to toil endlessly in their mines. Aware that she is the one weakness of her fearless brother, she worries about the burden she places on him.

King of the military superpower to the west, Rundall. Not caring in the least for justice or human nature, he decides everything on whether or not he finds interest in it. With a penchant for all things innovative, he is currently fascinated with the potential of guns. He is the bearer of an ancient ring entrusted by Gilgamesh.

A man enticed by the way of the sword, who traveled to the far east in order to pursue his mastery. He has no desire to become powerful, instead merely devoting his life to his training and attaining oneness with his blade through every technique he masters. This devotion has earned him great respect from Owe and Raviesse.

The forest I call home will be in festive spirits for Halloween tomorrow. Now that the trees have all been decorated, all that's left is to start the celebrations with a bang! All right, is everyone ready? Time to visit all of the houses. When they open the door, we'll say, "Hand over the sweets if you don't want to be minced meat!"

Once a bandit who raided villages and towns for whatever valuables they may possess, he now serves alongside his sister Lumeide as an enforcer for the Arms Dealers' Guild after catching the eye of its headsman, Garvall. Having indulged in the majority of nefarious deeds imaginable, he no longer feels guilt in any way or form.

The young king of Heindler. Freed from imprisonment in Lykeros Castle by Jayden, he now reveres the king of Rundall like a god. He falls in love with Princess Lucielle of the neighboring kingdom of Ovis, only for Jayden to order her death, plunging the young king into emotional turmoil.

The descendent of a warrior clan, the name of which means "hope" in their native tongue. Seeking a life of peace, they crossed the ocean from a great continent some twenty years ago. Though they secluded themselves and avoided contact with the outside world in an attempt to avoid war, she continued her training in earnest and grew to become one of the most capable martial artists amongst her people.

The prince of Lucis, a kingdom in the distant world of Eos. Having inherited the power to summon weapons through his royal bloodline, he is a powerful presence in battle. In accordance with the ceasefire agreement with the Niflheim Empire, he is set to marry Lady Lunafreya, a young woman hailing from an imperial province. He thus sets off for his wedding on a roadtrip with his best friends.

A young man from Lucis, a kingdom in the distant world of Eos. Though he is a regular citizen, he became one of Prince Noctis's closest friends. Originally an introvert, he strove to improve his communication skills and grew into quite the sociable character. He frequently takes pictures of the group's adventures together to keep as memories.

A white mage Mont's group encounters in a destitute frontier village. Moved by Mont's desperate efforts to save the village, she asks to join him and guide his group to Wezette. A girl of few words, there is likely more to her than meets the eye...

Imperial airborne division commodore of Niflheim, an empire in the distant world of Eos. Specializing in aerial assaults using a magitek lance, she is also referred to as a dragoon. She has earned the respect and loyalty of her troops thanks to her prowess in combat and her caring attitude.

An apprentice Warrior of the Crystals, unconfident and timid in character. Yet to learn which Crystal he will be assigned, he is still a fledgling compared to the other Warriors around him, but this also allows him to empathize with the weaknesses of others. He is unaware of the destiny that awaits him.

A young woman hailing originally from a village in southern Hourne, and best friends with Eliza. After her homeland fell victim to the Sanctum's greed-driven search for Crystals, she took to the road in hopes of finding her chance to strike back at her oppressors. Instead, she found Helena on the brink of death, and together they now work to support Leonis from the shadows.

The Warrior of the Wind Crystal. While she is always calm, composed, and highly capable in combat, her inability to read people is often a cause of discomfort for those around her. Guided by the Will of Light, she journeys from the Porcelain Tower in the Farplane to recover the Core Crystals that have been lost across time and space.

A mage from a distant world who tried to destroy the blue planet with two moons. Committing terrible atrocities, he attempted to seize the Crystals that lay in each land. He used many cruel tactics in his various confrontations with Cecil, including controlling Cecil's best friend, Kain, with the darkness that dwells within the dragoon's heart.

A member of Hourne's second division, «Nitor». Born in the east and originally intent on serving in Rundall, she fell in love with Adelard the moment she first laid eyes on him, and found herself siding with Hourne. Ever since she was a child, she has had a strong distaste for magic, which is partially the cause of her ever-confrontational relationship with Adelard's younger sister, Salire.

Look at all these people! And the old town feels like something out of a fairy tale, bathed in the light of those red paper lanterns. Come, hold my hand. We wouldn't want you getting lost. I can still hear the whispered blessings of the stars amongst the constant popping of firecrackers. They are telling me that this day promises to be more wonderful than the last.

I've heard you're supposed to spend these special nights with the ones you care for. I'm on my own, but it's not like I'm lonely or anything. But...if that's true, why do these tears come falling down my cheeks? That's when I hear a knock. I wipe my tears and run to the door. I run because I know it must be you standing on the other side.

A demon who appears in legends of old. Ibara dwells within a tree from which she has observed humanity for centuries. As many began praying to the tree, her essence gradually transitioned into a guardian spirit. Now she has no qualms about using her incredible power to help those counting on her.

The Warrior of the Fire Crystal. While she is always optimistic and full of zest no matter what she faces, her inability to comprehend human frailty often results in those around her being confounded by her straightforward philosophy on life. Answering the call to duty, she embarks on a journey to recover the Core Crystals that have been lost across time and space.

The Warrior of the Lightning Crystal. Level-headed under any circumstances, he is a natural leader who is always the first to take charge. Deeply trusted by the Will of Light for his role in keeping the unconventional Warriors of the Crystals together, he is both cautious and judicious, and never one to act purely based on mere speculation.

A young woman from a faraway world, born with magical powers, who became involved in the tale of the espers and humans. She was used as a tool for destruction by the Gestahlian Empire, which sought to subjugate the world. In the coal mining town of Narshe, she meets a young adventurer named Locke who invites her to join the Returners and fight against the Empire.

A youthful adventurer from a faraway world who became involved in the tale of the espers and humans. He brought Terra, a girl born with magical powers, to King Edgar of Figaro, who was seeking ways to fight back against the Gestahlian Empire. He also rescued General Celes, who in another city had been imprisoned as a traitor.

A general from a faraway world who became involved in the tale of the espers and humans. While she was a peerless force in battle, she opposed the cruel methods of the Gestahlian Empire, and this led her to be branded a traitor and thrown into prison. She was rescued the day before her execution by Locke, and thereafter joined forces with the Returners.

The Warrior of the Ice Crystal. Unmotivated on all occasions, he prefers to not get involved in anything he deems remotely troublesome. As the most senior of the Warriors of the Crystals, he is capable of unleashing great power when it is needed, but as he generally lacks for motivation, he is rarely relied upon to get things done. He once had a close, irreplaceable friend.

A young woman known as the Hero of Thunder in a distant world. She cannot stand injustice and appreciates strength and speed. She continues to traverse the realm to this day, searching for the "Great Destroyer" who ravaged her homeland.

A masked youth hailing from a distant world. His codename is "Joker," and his true identity is shrouded in mystery. By tearing off his own mask, he can wield a strange and devastating power known as a "Persona."

A masked youth with an air of authority about her. She calls herself "Queen." She found her way here unexpectedly when something went wrong while she pursued the Cognition of a foe she had once defeated.

A masked youth with a talent for an activity known as "rhythmic gymnastics." Her codename is "Violet." Confused by this whole situation, she searches for a way home, as she has unfinished business back in her own world.

A vision born from the inner turmoil of a former Warrior of the Crystals who was torn between his duties and his desire for freedom. His goal: to eradicate the Core Crystals and free the Warriors of the Crystals from their fate. He is an unlikely rebel who wishes for freedom and treasures his companions above all else.

One of the Six Fangs, the generals of Heindler. Though she began her military service in order to avenge her late brother, her talents quickly caught the eye of Gernsback, which led to her acquisition of the position she now holds. She dreams of someday restoring «Gladius», a division that was dissolved as a result of Jayden's influence.

The Little Leela from a time when she was on the road without a place to serve. She assures everyone that she stalked the shadows and struck fear into the hearts of her apparently hapless foes. The details of her past, particularly her deeds and degree of beauty, are most likely fanciful at best.

A warrior who wanders the lands in search of the right master to serve. She believes that there is nothing more beautiful than to meet one's mortality for the sake of another. Though tactless in her way with words, her manner is always calm and collected. When it comes to appearances, she is twice as picky as the average person, which often leads to her mood being spoiled whenever she spots someone disastrously dressed.

My head was filled with numbers, until you stepped into my heart. A spark that that lit my heart with sweet sadness. What is this, exactly? What does it mean? I need to understand it. I must deduce, induct, and define this new experience... Can it be...love?

The founder of the Church of the Crystal. With churches established across the continent of Ardra, he has amassed a great number of followers who worship him. He continues to gather Crystals to drain them of the power they contain, but it is unknown as to what his true ambitions are. He and Gilgamesh share a mutual hostility.

The founder of the Church of the Crystal. With churches established across the continent of Ardra, he has amassed a great number of followers who worship him. He continues to gather Crystals to drain them of the power they contain, but it is unknown as to what his true ambitions are. He and Gilgamesh share a mutual hostility.

She hails from a village located in southern Hourne and is best friends with Rafale. While providing support to Leonis alongside Helena, she vows revenge against Sadali for the destruction of her hometown. While she and Rafale have opposite personalities, there is one thing they have in common: a weakness for handsome fellows.

She hails from a village located in southern Hourne and is best friends with Rafale. While providing support to Leonis alongside Helena, she vows revenge against Sadali for the destruction of her hometown. While she and Rafale have opposite personalities, there is one thing they have in common: a weakness for handsome fellows.

Leaving Saiga behind, she travels from nation to nation in service of Melnia. She believes her mistress to be an incomparable, indisputable being and is willing to sacrifice everything to carry out her orders. She experiences neither emotion nor pain.

His family has served Ovis from his father's generation, and through this ongoing service he was charged with commanding the kingdom's first division, «Inviam». He loathes crookedness in all its forms, and always pursues injustice until it is rectified. Sensing something sinister within Ovis, he works in secrecy with his subordinate Valtoa to uncover what is afoot.

The alternate form of Fina, a girl who emerged from the Earth Crystal. Dubbed the "Demon of Hess" long ago, she possesses great magical power which she mainly employs in the form of offensive magic. When the world was in peril, she spent all of her power to save it, though the details of what transpired are unclear.

The alternate form of Fina, a girl who emerged from the Earth Crystal. Dubbed the "Demon of Hess" long ago, she possesses great magical power which she mainly employs in the form of offensive magic. When the world was in peril, she spent all of her power to save it, though the details of what transpired are unclear.

Come on now. We have a grand battle ahead of us, but there's no need to get too excited. I understand, though, I do—which is why we hit the beach today! Go change into your swimwear! We march again once you lot have cooled off. And then, together, we write the new pages of history!

Succeeding Robb, her late father and king, she assumed the throne to become the queen of Hourne. As ruler of a nation, her heart for her subjects remains ever strong, as does her dedication to live in the name of her vassals and the citizens of Hourne. She is concerned for her sworn sister, Glaciela, who faces a difficult path, and often shares her wisdom and advice.

A former security agent who appears in the story of another world, protected by a shroud of deception. When her sister Serah is marked as a l'Cie, she rebels against the very military she served in order to free the l'Cie from oppression. She later learns of her own destiny and fights to defy it.

A boy who appears in the story of another world, protected by a shroud of deception. He was to be disposed of after becoming a l'Cie, but he resists—and his mother perishes before his eyes in the resulting struggle. As he travels with his companions, he discovers the great power that dwells within him and learns to no longer be one who needs protecting, but one who protects others.

A man who appears in the story of another world, protected by a shroud of deception. He is the leader of NORA, a group fighting against the Sanctum military in order to protect the l'Cie. Though he is seen as a spirited and positive hothead by his companions, it is actually a manifestation of his need to avenge those who have fallen throughout this conflict.

Successor to the former nation of Wezette's throne. After defeating Khury, her father and the former king, she showed no interest in following in his footsteps. Instead, she wishes to remove the nobility from Wezette and make it a country governed by the people, for the people. Her unwavering resolve on this matter has earned her the ire of many nobles and royalists.

A member of Jayden's personal guard, «Vanum». Having sworn to live his life by the blade, he is almost seen as an outcast in the gun-favoring kingdom of Rundall. Regardless, he never fails to continue his daily pursuit of refining his skills, for he believes that nothing is impossible for a blade that has been mastered to perfection.

A young girl who was orphaned by war and subsequently taken in by the princess of Heindler, Alaya, who is the only person she does not view as a foe. She loses control of herself when Alaya is endangered in any way: suppressed emotions erupt, turning her into a weapon-like force of destruction.

Our year-long wait is over, and Halloween has returned. We must smash the forces of Light so that we cannot be pushed back again into the dark underworld, and this hallowed eve is our only chance. Come forth, brothers and sisters! Let us follow Underqueen Salire and conquer the world!

The princess of the kingdom of Heindler and sister by blood to Oberon. She places value in the bloodline of the Heindler family above all else. She has known Jayden since she was little, as the nations of Heindler and Rundall have always been on friendly terms. Trusting only what she has seen with her own eyes, Alaya has a stubborn side that refuses to yield easily.

A young woman who leads the People of the Forest in place of her late partner, Vidd. While she did not desire her position of leadership, she accepted it in order to keep her people together. Pushing her personal sadness and despair deep within her heart, she boldly stands on the front line of battle to protect those she holds dear.

So this is the ocean... You said there was somewhere you wanted to bring me, and I kept wondering what place that could possibly be... I have never gazed upon such a beautiful scene. Beyond the horizon must lie lands we have yet to discover. I want to see them...with you by my side.

A soldier serving in Glaciela's private brigade, «Spirare». She is the childhood friend and something of an older sister to Glaciela. Possessing neither family nor status, her future was precarious until Glaciela saved her from spiraling into ruin. Now, she is prepared to risk her life at any time in the name of Glaciela's cause.

A young girl from a village that was destroyed by «Solennes», First Division of the mighty Lykeros, a kingdom in the west. For many years, she hated and despised «Solennes», but in a strange twist of fate, she opened her heart to the division's deputy commander, Jurial, and eventually found herself fighting alongside him.

A bunny-loving paladin appearing in the story of a different world. She excels at supporting her allies more than wielding a sword in battle. Having lost her sister, she learned the art of healing so as to never experience the loss of a loved one ever again.

Hehe. I bet you didn't expect this. Do you like it? ...Huh? Are you truly confounded by this attire? *sigh* You've really forgotten then? Winter festivities have begun. Here, look out the window—it's a blanket of snow as far as the eye can see. Don't you think we can skip training and enjoy the peace and quiet? Just for tonight.

Kitone and I were raised like sisters back in Saiga. Before long, we would serve separate nations, but that changes nothing about how I feel toward her. Let us return to our innocent days as children so we can laugh and play until the sun sets.
A reigning lord from a distant world, said to bring destruction to all. Having the power to cover the world in darkness, he was even described as loving despair, hatred, and sadness.
A light blue, droplet-shaped monster that inhabits a distant world in large numbers. The adversary first seen by many adventurers, it is well known and well adored.

A reigning master of monsterkind from a distant world with the appearance of a handsome young man. Unparalleled in swordsmanship and leadership, he is idolized by a great deal of his subordinates as a charismatic presence. He is said to harbor deep hatred for humans for some reason.

Home awaits. A home where I can pass the time with my parents, my siblings...and forget about the battlefield for just one special day. We'll sit around the table, express our appreciation for the year that has passed, and speak of our hopes for the year that is to come. Now is the time for expectations and preparations. We shall ready ourselves for our next leap forward.

The Warrior of the Water Crystal. A motherly lady brimming with kindness who always has a smile on her face. No other Warrior loves Raph more, and she does everything she can to ensure she never spends a moment without her. Perrene is terrifying when she gets angry.

A scientist forcefully transported to Ardra from the future alongside Gilgamesh. Having had a hand in developing the autonomous weapon «Realmscourge», she is fully aware of how terrifying it is. In an attempt to destroy «Realmscourge» and return to her own world, she has repeatedly traveled to the past to change history.

The Warrior of the Earth Crystal. A consummate professional who never falters no matter what great foe or adversity he faces, completing his missions with quiet confidence. That, however, is merely one aspect of his personality. The true Rulgia that lies beneath that cloak of confidence is known only to a select few.

One of the Servants of the Void. She is a seemingly kind and gentle figure, but in truth, her words drip with honeyed lies and deceptions that turn people's minds and drive them to ruin. Deceit, trickery, and duplicity are her endless game, but no one knows for what purpose she plays.

A member of the Orders, a group of elite warriors directly under the command of the Emperor of Aldore. A swordsman of remarkable ability, he surpasses all of the other Orders—yet his identity is a total mystery. Not a soul knows of the firm resolution or tragic sentiments that lie hidden beneath the black beast's mask.

The man who directs the Arms Dealers of Ardra. He now stands opposed to the Sanctum after rejecting Sadali's demand for his subservience. Always seeking impartiality, Galzahk believes he and his people are what ensures the balance between the great houses.

An alchemist with a metal right arm and left leg. Long ago, these parts of his body were taken as the price for the taboo he committed with his younger brother. While searching for a way to recover his lost limbs along with his brother's entire body, he realizes that a great evil lurks deep within the state and challenges it to battle.

An alchemist whose body is a suit of armor. Out of desperation, his older brother drew a transmutation circle inside the armor using his own blood, and thus this alchemist's soul was bound to the hollow armor. He and his brother continue their journey to recover his lost body, and on the road he will find his way into adulthood.

A colonel in the state military of Amestris, a nation in a distant world. Highly ambitious in his military career, he is a man with a strong desire to attain power in order to build a world without war—and by doing so, fulfill a promise he made to the comrades he lost on a horrific battlefield. In this pursuit, he shows no mercy to whomever stands in his way.

A one-eyed man from a distant world. He serves as the Führer-President of a nation, but his true identity is that of a homunculus with an uroboros mark on his left eye—an Ultimate Eye that he keeps hidden beneath an eyepatch. He remains loyal to his creator and works behind the scenes to execute a grand scheme.

Overcoming the darkness Sadali planted in his heart, Sterne comes to terms with his own wrongdoings after learning of his father's strength and kindness, and now stands steeled in his resolve to fight in the name of redemption. He travels alongside Seymore, the best friend of his late master, Owe.

Father to Rain and Lasswell. A knight of great renown who served to protect the people and kingdom of Grandshelt. Various rumors surround his existence, such as him once having been a member of the Sworn Eight, or that he is of a certain royal bloodline, but the details of these claims are unknown.

An archmage from a distant world where espers and magic once existed. Highly trusted by Emperor Gestahl, he takes care of missions such as invading other nations or hunting espers. His mind was irreparably damaged by an artificial infusion of magic, leaving him both unhinged and indifferent to his heartless acts.

One of the Servants of the Void. A warrior in the grip of crushing sorrow, cursed by fate to resent and envy all things. He despises himself for what he is, but is powerless to change it. So instead, he throws himself into violence and bloodshed in a desperate bid to escape his endless suffering.

The vision of a performer from a distant world, armed with a beautiful voice and dance moves that charm all who behold her. When Queen Machérie of Hourne's camp is attacked by monsters, she rushes to Camillo's aid and ends up joining him on a journey to rescue Machérie.

Sword training never ends, does it? It's a special day today, so thought I'd try my hand at making some chocolate. Oh, but be warned—I'm not a great cook. Anyway, I really hope you like them... Wait, what? You like them? That makes me really happy. I'll make even better ones next year, too, just for you.

The eldest son of the Groms family. Handsome as he is masterful with a blade, his love for every single woman in the world knows no bounds. After being disowned by his father, who was also his sword master, he began traveling the lands with his younger brother and sister—Tyytas and Chel. These circumstances, however, also served as a pretense that allowed him to carry out a certain secret task.

A warrior of Ovis who served as a personal guard to Princess Lucielle. Following the sudden declaration of war from Rundall, Ovis dispatched a small unit of troops to seek reinforcements from Hourne, only for them to go missing. Convinced that she must handle the task herself, Deah sets off on her journey to Hourne without the princess's blessing.

The leader of the Servants of the Void. His aim is to use the Power of the Void to eradicate all life on Ardra and that of other worlds. He has set his sights on Ardra as a medium to amplify the Void and expedite the destruction of worlds.

A young man who appears in the Crystal Tales of a faraway world. Following his father's wish, he set out to travel the world astride his trusted chocobo, Boko. On his journey he arrived at the site of a meteorite strike, where he met Lenna, a princess of Tycoon, and Galuf, an old man beset with amnesia, and set off with them on an adventure to protect the crystals.

A princess of the realm of Tycoon, who appears in the Crystal Tales of a faraway world. She was traveling to the Wind Shrine in pursuit of her father when she encountered Bartz and Galuf, and together they set off on a quest to protect the world's crystals. She has a gentle and steadfast heart, and cares deeply for all animals.

A pirate captain who appears in the Crystal Tales of a faraway world. She has long commanded the ruffians of the seas with an iron fist, all the while disguised as a man. When she learns that Lenna is of royal blood, she takes her hostage in the hopes of demanding a fine ransom, but when she sees they wear the same pendant, decides to throw in her lot with the princess and her party.

The Warrior of the Dark Crystal. Although unquestionably powerful, she is generally detached and lacking in motivation. She has not completely forsaken her duty as a Warrior of the Crystals, but she spends most of her time avoiding the Will of Light, lest she be given a mission she cannot be bothered doing.

The king of Rundall, a great military nation in west Ardra. After being taken captive by Lykeros alongside Oberon, he incites an uprising and successfully overruns Lykeros from within. Following this, he begins planning for the restoration of Rundall and Heindler, as well as a ceremony to strengthen the two nations' bond.

The white sand. The blue waves. The glistening of the sun's rays. I can't believe I didn't know such a wonderful place existed in Ardra. I am most grateful that you've brought me here. Now we have yet another precious moment together to look back on. If only the day didn't have to end...

Sister to Oberon, the young prince of Heindler. Childhood friends with Jayden, she was always envious of the friendship her brother and their neighboring prince shared. Her desire to stand on the battlefield alongside Jayden would lead to her using guns instead of the symbolic weapon of Heindler, the spear.

The second princess of Ovis. During the war with Rundall, she had her sisters Lucielle and Rasheena escape the castle in an attempt to have them slain at the hand of the invaders and make the kingdom of Ovis her own. She intended to then marry Oberon in order to stand against Jayden, but fate had other plans...

The commander of Rundall's first division, «Sonitus», which is now believed to be disbanded. His parents were followers of the Crystal faith who leaked Rundall battle plans to Sadali, an act which resulted in the kingdom suffering a defeat that would shape the lives of many. After that, Gryfford quit the military and fell into a life of drink and dissolution.

A young man who appears in the story of another world where sorceresses continue to pass their power down through the ages. He's part of the mercenary group SeeD and is proficient in a normally unwieldy weapon known as a gunblade. A childhood experience left him with an aversion to associating with others, and now he does everything in his power to live his life on his own.

A young woman who appears in the story of another world where sorceresses continue to pass their power down through the ages. She's a member of a resistance group fighting for the independence of a city occupied by Galbadia. She visits Balamb Garden to enlist the help of the mercenary group SeeD and has a fateful encounter with Squall.

A young man who appears in the story of another world where sorceresses continue to pass their power down through the ages. Recognized for his prowess as a marksman, he was appointed to the main role in assassinating a sorceress. Despite how irritating his confidence can be, he's actually delicate at heart and pretends to be carefree in order to deal with the overwhelming pressure of the responsibility placed upon him.

One of Hess's Eight Sages, who was sealed in a certain land. During that time, he was tainted by the evil will of humans, causing him to hate all forms of life and grow convinced that death is the only solution. He says that Rain's hypocrisy burns brighter than the sun, while he is the truth-illuminating moon.

The leader of Heindler's generals, the Six Fangs. While proud of the blood of the dragon that flows through his body, he has sworn his loyalty to the Heindler family. Believing their bloodline to be of the greatest venerability, he is prepared to eliminate any who endanger it.

A moon of crimson hue, perfect for a masquerade... Now, offer your blood tithe, stain the night skies red! Dawn does not yet draw near, so go. Go into the night and revel in its darkness! ...Oh, c'mon Lady Jeume. Why are you laughing!?

With Ranell by her side, she has traversed numerous kingdoms in order to claim Jayden's life. However, with the conclusion of the War of the Gale Highlands, the target of her clandestine activities has changed. Now, she seeks the Six Swords—the keys to locating the Mournblade—but the true purpose of her presence remains shrouded in mystery.

The only daughter of the Vered family, who govern an independent land on the border of Leonis and Wezette. The Vereds are careful to maintain their neutrality, but when monsters or Fennes attack their lands, Helena does not hesitate to march into battle at the head of the «Royal Thorns». She is known as the Black Rose of the Battlefield, and feared for the powerful magic that she wields.

A young member of a band of thieves who appear in the tales of the distant world of Gaia. After kidnapping the princess of a particular kingdom—and though she was already determined to abscond—he becomes quite taken with her during the course of their adventure. His sunny disposition and lighthearted exterior might give the impression that he gets carried away easily, but these qualities belie a different nature within.

The princess of Alexandria who appears in tales of the distant world of Gaia. She escaped with Zidane in hopes of finding a way to stop her mother from invading other countries. While traveling under the alias of "Dagger," she learns two truths: that of her birth and that of a plot that will lead to the world's destruction.

A young black mage who appears in tales of the distant world of Gaia. Swept up in the commotion caused by Zidane and Tantalus's kidnapping of the princess, he goes on to join forces with them soon after. Though he is always timid in demeanor and lacks the ability to make his own judgments or take action, he possesses incredible potential as a mage.

Tonight is the holy night...and I am the white witch that descends upon the glittering ground. Yes, that's me! Magical girl Raph! With the cheers of all the good boys and girls, my true powers have been released from...the deepest abyss... Wait, ugh, that's the wrong lore. Double wait, I didn't even write a backstory for this! No wonder I can't get into character!

The young king of Leonis. With the aid of an ancient ring bestowed upon him by his forefathers and an alliance with the neighboring nation of Wezette, he staves off the invasions from the barbaric nation of Fennes while seeking a way to bring lasting peace and stability to the lands of Ardra.

A young scholar born in the Kingdom of Pharm, in a world line where Ardra sank into the sea. After meeting Lucio, he regains his memories of his past life and resolves to fight alongside the Warriors of the Crystals to save his home.

A missionary born in the holy land of Tessera, far to the south of Ardra. Alongside her fellow sister, Shelva, she crossed the ocean not only to spread the Crystal Faith, but to investigate the disappearance of Sadali and Exia, whose fates had since been unknown after they ventured to Ardra themselves long ago.

Commander of Lykeros's second division, ≪Obtritus≫. Climbing the ranks of advancement with his fists earned him his share of enemies from within his own nation, but those, too, he crushed with the very same fists. The king of Lykeros shows him favor, and for this he swears his loyalty and does everything in his power to please his king.

A prototype specializing in close-range combat originally belonging to the YoRHa soldiers, a group from a faraway world made up of androids. Deployment of this model served to prepare for the practical application of newer models such as 2B and 9S. Her official designation is YoRHa Type A No. 2.

A member of an elite division of warriors from another world, the Sworn Eight. He boasts the ability to gracefully move through the skies and can control the wind. Although he views humans as lowly creatures of the dirt and won't hesitate to exterminate them, rumor has it that he was originally a much different man.

An android soldier from a faraway world in which a military force known as YoRHa can be found. This android is believed to be a reproduction based on a specific YoRHa unit with exceptional survival skills, but further details regarding this are unknown.

Lucio, Warrior of the Light Crystal, after having unlocked his ultimate power through an awakening said to be rare for a Warrior of the Crystals. He attained this true form when his once-undefined wishes as an individual and the sentiments of a past Warrior of the Light Crystal became one.

The light of dawn will soon sweep across the lands, celebrating them with a sun-kissed blessing that marks the beginning of the new year. Let us share these felicitations for a happy and peaceful year to come, and stride into it with those who have a place in our hearts—together, towards a future in which all can smile.

A shinobi serving Dario, the now king of Hourne, on an Ardra threatened with destruction and ruin by the Ashen King. Slain once by the Ashen King's army, she fuses with a crystal on another world to be resurrected as something beyond human. Placing her newfound, fleeting life on the line, she now fights alongside the Warriors of the Crystals.

A young shinobi who has crossed between numerous worlds in service of her master, Ashen King Mont. Absolute in her loyalty to the Ashen King, she is never far from his side. When Mont was saved from the brink of death by a certain benevolent presence, Kitone too was taken to the Farplane, where she was extensively trained in martial arts by Perrene.

A member of an elite division of warriors from another world, the Sworn Eight. Formidable in many ways, she freely manipulates water and forces foes to dance in the palm of her hand by using cruel tactics. She is known for her ruthlessness, but rumors have it that she has been benevolent in the past, and that her vicious personality is not her true nature.

The now king of Hourne, fated to fight for his people in an Ardra threatened with destruction and ruin by the Ashen King Mont. Having fallen once to the Ashen King's blade, he fuses with a crystal and is resurrected as something beyond human. Burning with life once again, he fights for hope and the future.

A warrior who appears in the story of another world, protected by a shroud of deception. Despite her mark of the l'Cie, she worked with the Sanctum military to learn the whereabouts of her dear friend after waking with no memory—and in order to complete their Focus. The two would later reunite and continue their journey together.

A peerless military strategist who supports the Ashen King's Army behind the scenes. Once a servant of Fennes on a timeline where its ambitions shaped Ardra's history, she gave up everything in despair for what Muraga had become—including her very life—only to be saved from her fate by Mont. She now swears absolute allegiance to her savior and serves him steadfastly.

A goddess of spring who shares blessings far and wide with all people around the world. This beautiful form bloomed in manifestation of the reverence and admiration everyone has for Jeume. Carrying those sentiments in her heart, she wields her blade anew with flourishing grace.

A lancer in the service of the Ashen King and the younger brother of Lilyth, Mont's former right hand. After her passing, Volke was raised with great care by Mont and the others. While thankful to Mont for this, he struggles on a daily basis to achieve recognition as a man in his own right.

A member of an elite division of warriors from another world, the Sworn Eight. A powerful warrior who boasts seemingly limitless stamina and the ability to manipulate the very earth as he pleases. He sees a worthy opponent and rival in Fina of the Eight Sages of Hess, called a terrifying demon by many, and looks forward to doing battle with her above all else.

The Ashen King, a dreadful being who appeared unexpectedly with the desire to destroy all worlds. His true identity is that of Prince Mont of Leonis, once thought to have been killed after being branded a traitor. Having taken the ultimate power of the Core Crystals as his own, he begins his destruction—so that all may be reborn.

A young man who appears in the story of a distant world, seeking to rebuild after the calamity known as Meteorfall. When yet another crisis threatens the planet, Cloud finds the will to face a new fight—and an old nemesis—together with his former comrades.

A young woman who appears in the story of a distant world, seeking to rebuild after the calamity known as Meteor struck. After saving the planet from destruction, she lived a peaceful life until a new crisis reared its head. Fighting alongside her comrades and giving Cloud the push that he needed, Tifa watches vigilantly as he takes on his revived nemesis.

The third son of the renowned military family of House Beoulve. He appears in the legend of the Zodiac Stones, a story passed down in the otherworld of Ivalice. After much training, he achieved knighthood at the Royal Military Akademy. However, being born of a different mother than his older brothers—who already serve in prominent posts in the Order—he still feels somewhat inferior in their presence.
Assign Stats Equivalent to MR Paladin

A machinist from a continent other than Ardra who specializes in constructing personalized weapons. She left her hometown to travel the world and polish her skills. Her credo is that there is a weapon for everyone.

A dragoon from Hourne's first division, «Solidus», who idolizes Engelbert's willingness to sacrifice himself in order to protect his allies. A rather hot-blooded man, his ancestor was one of few to be recognized by the dragon, but he makes sure not to let it go to his head.
